metadata.title: CVE-2017-16544 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the add_match function in libbb/lineedit.c in BusyBox through 1.27.2,the tab autocomplete feature of the shell, used to get a list of filenamesin a directory, does not sanitize filenames and results in executing anyescape sequence in the terminal. This could potentially result in codeexecution, arbitrary file writes, or other attacks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16544` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

busybox - 1:1.27.2-1ubuntu4
busybox-initramfs - 1:1.27.2-1ubuntu4
busybox-static - 1:1.27.2-1ubuntu4
busybox-syslogd - 1:1.27.2-1ubuntu4
udhcpc - 1:1.27.2-1ubuntu4
udhcpd - 1:1.27.2-1ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: busybox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.27.2-1ubuntu4').
